title: Qatar to Represent U.S. Interests in Afghanistan as Evacuation Winds Down
sub_head: As protecting power, Qatar will serve role in Afghanistan that Swiss Embassy does for U.S. in Iran
body:
WASHINGTON—The U.S. has struck a deal with Qatar to represent its diplomatic interests in Afghanistan, where Washington doesn’t recognize the Taliban-led government and no longer maintains an embassy.
Secretary of State Antony Blinken said the key Gulf ally, which hosted U.S. talks with the Taliban and helped with the evacuation of U.S. troops and citizens, will serve as Washington’s protecting power in Afghanistan.
